Kelly W. Zhang

about

I am in my final year of undergraduate study at New York University. I study computer science and am particularly interested in machine learning and natural language understanding. I am very fortunate to be a member of the Machine Learning for Language Lab (ML²) at CILVR and to be advised by Sam Bowman.

Preprint

Adversarially Regularized Autoencoders for Generating Discrete Structures
Junbo (Jake) Zhao, Yoon Kim, Kelly Zhang, Alexander Rush, and Yann LeCun.
arXiv 2017
[pdf] [code]

work

  • I am a grader for the fall 2017 instantiation of the NYU Data Science course Natural Language Processing with Representation Learning (DS-GA 1011), which is jointly taught by Sam Bowman and Kyunghyun Cho.

  • I spent summer 2017 working at the eBay New York office on the homepage recommendations team. My project was on detecting "Not Suitable for Work" items based on images and text. My work is being put into production as a part of eBay's recommendation pipeline.

reading group

I presented a couple papers at the ML² reading group.

Long Short Term Memory
On the original LSTM paper, the importance of gates, and highway networks (April 18, 2017).
[presentation]

Text Disentanglement
On two text disentanglement papers: Toward Controlled Generation of Text and Style Transfer with Non-Parallel Corpora (July 25, 2017).
[presentation]
